transcript_chunks.text: one of the best games of the year is a game you probably haven't heard of but one they can play right now for cheap on xbox game pass immortality is an amazing fmv game making use of live-action footage to tell the story of an actress named marissa marcel the aim of the game is to compile and sift through a myriad of lost film footage and outtakes from marcel's time performing in three films that never saw the light of day the interesting gameplay hook here is that to uncover new clips you'll need to click on a person or object in the frame this then allows the software to jump to a different clip that features that same subject it's a fun mix of puzzle game detective mystery thriller and film nerd bull that both invested me in figuring out the full picture and filled me with nostalgia for film class the hitchcock vibes here are strong with performances that blew me away and firmly placed me into the film era of the late 1900s it's a game that has a lot to say about the nature of

for film class the hitchcock vibes here are strong with performances that blew me away and firmly placed me into the film era of the late 1900s it's a game that has a lot to say about the nature of auteurism the everlasting presence of film and art depiction of sexuality and a lot more there's a good deal beneath the surface that i don't want to spoil but if you want to play a game that is a love letter to the art of film look no further because
